dItem.boxText: <font size='22'>The countries that produced more coal and pig iron had more factories.</font>
<font size='22'>Pig iron and coal production quadrupled in the UK between 1831 and 1850.</font>
<font size='20'>Rising raw cotton consumption was related to increasing coal and pig iron production.</font>
<font size='22'>Industrial cities in Britain grew faster than those in Belgium.</font>
<font size='22'>The German States had few resources.</font>
<font size='20'>By 1850 coal and pig iron in the UK had other uses besides the textile industry.</font>
<font size='20'>Coal production in each country was in direct proportion to raw cotton consumption. </font>
<font size='20'>The relationship between these commodities was similar in France and the UK.</font>
